tree.Alt: Double click a node to query the computer

node.Alt: Classes that represent hardware related objects.
The Cooling Devices subcategory groups classes that represent instrumentable fans, temperature probes, and refrigeration devices.
Represents the properties of a fan device in the computer system.
Represents the properties of a heat pipe cooling device.
Represents the properties of a refrigeration device.
Represents the properties of a temperature sensor (electronic thermometer).
The Input Devices subcategory groups classes that represent keyboards and pointing devices.
Represents a keyboard installed on a Windows system.
Represents an input device used to point to and select regions on the display of a Windows computer system.
Classes in the Mass Storage subcategory represent storage devices such as hard disk drives, CD-ROM drives, and tape drives.
Represents the settings for the autocheck operation of a disk.
Represents a CD-ROM drive on a Windows computer system.
Represents a physical disk drive as seen by a computer running the Windows operating system.
Manages the capabilities of a floppy disk drive.
Represents any type of documentation or storage medium.
Represents a tape drive on a Windows computer.
The Motherboard, Controllers, and Ports subcategory groups classes that represent system devices. Examples include system memory, cache memory, and controllers.
Represents the capabilities and management of a 1394 controller.
Relates the high-speed serial bus (IEEE 1394 Firewire) Controller and the CIM_LogicalDevice instance connected to it.
Relates a logical device to a system resource.
Relates a processor and its cache memory.
Represents a baseboard (also known as a motherboard or system board).
Represents the attributes of the computer system's basic input/output services (BIOS) that are installed on the computer.
Represents a physical bus as seen by a Windows operating system.
Represents cache memory (internal and external) on a computer system.
Represents the hubs downstream from the universal serial bus (USB) controller.
Relates a system bus and a logical device using the bus.
Represents a device memory address on a Windows system.
Relates a logical device and a setting that can be applied to it.
Represents a direct memory access (DMA) channel on a Windows computer system.
Represents the capabilities and management capacity of a floppy disk drive controller.
Represents the capabilities of an Integrated Drive Electronics (IDE) controller device.
Association class that relates an IDE controller and the logical device.
Represents the capabilities and management of an infrared device.
Represents an interrupt request line (IRQ) number on a Windows computer system.
Represents the properties of the computer system memory array and mapped addresses.
Relates a logical memory array and the physical memory array upon which it exists.
Represents the properties of a computer system's memory device along with it's associated mapped addresses.
Relates a memory device and the memory array in which it resides.
Association class that relates a memory device and the physical memory on which it exists.
Represents a device that contains the central components of the Windows computer system.
Represents common adapter devices built into the motherboard (system board).
Represents the properties of a parallel port on a Windows computer system.
Manages the capabilities of a Personal Computer Memory Card Interface Adapter (PCMCIA) controller device.
Represents a physical memory device located on a computer as available to the operating system.
Represents details about the computer system's physical memory.
Relates an array of physical memory and its physical memory.
Represents an association between logical devices and system resources.
Relates a device (known to Configuration Manager as a PNPEntity), and the function it performs.
Represents the properties of a Plug and Play device.
Represents physical connection ports, such as DB-25 pin male, Centronics, and PS/2.
Represents an I/O port on a Windows computer system.
Represents a device capable of interpreting a sequence of machine instructions on a Windows computer system.
Represents a small computer system interface (SCSI) controller on a Windows system.
Relates a SCSI controller and the logical device (disk drive) connected to it.
Represents a serial port on a Windows system.
Represents the settings for data transmission on a Windows serial port.
Relates a serial port and its configuration settings.
Represents the capabilities and management of memory-related logical devices.
Represents the properties of a sound device on a Windows computer system.

Relates a computer system (including data such as startup properties, time zones, boot configurations, or administrative passwords) and a system BIOS (services, languages, system management properties).
Relates a Plug and Play device on the Windows computer system and the driver that supports the Plug and Play device.
Represents the properties associated with a physical system enclosure.
Represents a system memory resource on a Windows system.
Represents physical connection points including ports, motherboard slots and peripherals, and proprietary connections points.
Manages the capabilities of a universal serial bus (USB) controller.
Relates a USB controller and the CIM_LogicalDevice instances connected to it.
Represents the management characteristics of a USB hub.
The Networking Devices subcategory groups classes that represent the network interface controller, its configurations, and its settings.
Represents a network adapter on a Windows system.

Represents the attributes and behaviors of a network adapter. The class is not guaranteed to be supported after the ratification of the Distributed Management Task Force (DMTF) CIM network specification.
Relates a network adapter and its configuration settings.
The Power subcategory groups classes that represent power supplies, batteries, and events related to these devices.
Relates a logical device and the battery it is using.
Represents a battery connected to the computer system.
Represents the properties of a current monitoring sensor (ammeter).
Represents the properties of a portable battery, such as one used for a notebook computer.
Represents power management events resulting from power state changes.
Represents the capabilities and management capacity of an uninterruptible power supply (UPS).
Represents the properties of a voltage sensor (electronic voltmeter).
The Printing subcategory groups classes that represent printers, printer configurations, and print jobs.
Relates a printer to a printer driver.
Represents a device connected to a Windows computer system that is capable of reproducing a visual image on a medium.
Defines the configuration for a printer device.
Relates a printer and the local device to which the printer is connected.
Represents the drivers for a Win32_Printer instance.
Relates a local printer and its driver file (not the driver itself).
Relates a printer and its configuration settings.
Represents a print job generated by a Windows application.
Represents a TCP/IP service access point.
The Telephony subcategory groups classes that represent 'plain old telephone' modem devices and their associated serial connections.
Represents the services and characteristics of a Plain Old Telephone Service (POTS) modem on a Windows system.
Relates a modem and the serial port the modem uses.
The Video and Monitors subcategory groups classes that represent monitors, video cards, and their associated settings.
Represents the type of monitor or display device attached to the computer system.

Represents configuration information for the display device on a Windows system. This class is obsolete. In place of this class, use the properties in the Win32_VideoController, Win32_DesktopMonitor, and CIM_VideoControllerResolution classes.

Represents the video adapter configuration information of a Windows system. This class is obsolete. In place of this class, use the properties in the Win32_VideoController, Win32_DesktopMonitor, and CIM_VideoControllerResolution classes.

This class has been eliminated from Windows XP and later; attempts to use it will generate a fatal error. In place of this class, use the properties contained in the Win32_VideoController, Win32_DesktopMonitor, and CIM_VideoControllerResolution classes.
Represents the capabilities and management capacity of the video controller on a Windows computer system.
Relates a video controller and video settings that can be applied to it.
Classes that represent operating system related objects.
The COM subcategory groups classes that represent COM and DCOM settings, classes, and client application settings.
Association class Relates a DCOM application and a COM component grouped under it.
Instance class Represents the properties of a COM component.
Association class Relates a COM class and the settings used to configure instances of the COM class.
Association class Relates an executable and a DCOM application that contains the DCOM configuration options for the executable file.
Instance class Represents a COM application.
Association class Relates a COM component and the COM application where it resides.
Association class Relates a DCOM application and its configuration settings.
Instance class Represents the properties of a Component Object Model (COM) component.
Association class Relates a COM class and another COM class that it automatically emulates.
Association class Relates two versions of a COM class.
Instance class Represents a component category.
Instance class Represents the settings associated with a COM component or COM application.
Instance class Represents the properties of a DCOM application.
Association class Relates the Win32_DCOMApplication instance and the user security identifications (SID) that can access it.
Association class Relates the Win32_DCOMApplication instance and the user SIDs that can launch it.
Instance class Represents the settings of a DCOM application.
Association class Relates a component category and the COM class using its interfaces.
The Desktop subcategory groups classes that represent objects that define a specific desktop configuration.
Instance class Represents the common characteristics of a user's desktop.
Instance class Represents an environment or system environment setting on a Windows computer system.
Instance class Represents the time zone information for a Windows system.
Association class Relates a user account and desktop settings that are specific to it.
The Drivers subcategory groups classes that represent virtual device drivers and system drivers for base services.
Instance class Represents a virtual device driver on a Windows computer system.
Instance class Represents the system driver for a base service.

The File System subcategory groups classes that represent the way a hard disk is logically arranged. This includes the type of file system used, the directory structure, and way the disk is partitioned.
Association class Relates logical devices and data files, indicating the driver files used by the device.
Instance class Represents a directory entry on a Windows computer system.
Instance class Represents the directory layout for the product.
Association class Relates a disk drive and a partition existing on it.
Instance class Represents the capabilities and management capacity of a partitioned area of a physical disk on a Windows system.
Association class Tracks disk space usage for NTFS file system volumes.
Represents a data source that resolves to an actual local storage device on a Windows system.
Association class Relates a logical disk and its directory structure.
Association class Relates a logical disk drive and the disk partition it resides on.
Represents network storage devices that are mapped as logical disks on the computer system.
Association class Represents the association between a CIM_ManagedSystemElement instance and the settings defined for it.
Instance class Contains setting information for disk quotas on a volume.
Instance class Represents files that are shortcuts to other files, directories, and commands.
Association class Relates a directory (folder) and one of its subdirectories (subfolders).
Association class Relates a computer system and a disk partition on that system.
Instance class Represents an area of storage on a hard disk.
Association class Relates a volume to the per volume quota settings.
Association class Relates disk quota settings with a specific disk volume.
Association class Relates per user quotas to quota enabled volumes.
The Job Objects subcategory groups classes that represent classes that provide the means of instrumenting named job objects. An unnamed job object cannot be instrumented.
Association class Relates a managed system element collection and the class representing statistical information about the collection.
Instance class Represents a locally unique identifier (LUID)
Instance class Represents a LUID and its attributes.
Instance class Represents a kernel object that is used to group processes for the sake of controlling the life and resources of the processes within the job object.
Instance class Represents the I/O accounting information for a job object.
Instance class Represents an association between a job object and the job object limit settings.
Instance class Represents the limit settings for a job object.
Instance class Relates a job object and the process contained in the job object.
Instance class Relates a job object and the job object security limit settings.
Instance class Represents the security limit settings for a job object.
Instance class Represents an association between a job object and the job object I/O accounting information class.
Instance class Represents a security identifier (SID) and its attributes.
Event class Represents information about the group SIDs in an access token.
Event class Represents information about a set of privileges for an access token.
The Memory and Page files subcategory groups classes that represent page file configuration settings.
Instance class This class is obsolete and has been replaced by the Win32_OperatingSystem class.
Instance class Represents the file used for handling virtual memory file swapping on a Windows system.
Association class Relates the initial settings of a page file and the state of those setting during normal use.
Instance class Represents the settings of a page file.
Instance class Represents the file used for handling virtual memory file swapping on a Windows system.
Association class This class is obsolete because the properties existing in the Win32_LogicalMemoryConfiguration class are now a part of the Win32_OperatingSystem class.
The class in the Multimedia Audio/Visual subcategory represents properties of the audio or video codec installed on the computer system.
Instance class Represents the audio or video codec installed on the computer system.
The Networking subcategory groups classes that represent network connections, network clients, and network connection settings such as the protocol used.
Association class Relates the current IP4 route to the persisted IP route table.
Instance class Represents persisted IP routes.
Instance class Represents information that governs the routing of network data packets.
Event class Represents IP route change events.
Instance class Represents a network client on a Windows system.
Instance class Represents an active network connection in a Windows environment.
Instance class Represents a protocol and its network characteristics on a Windows computer system.
Instance class Represents a Windows NT domain.
Instance class Represents the values returned by the standard ping command.
Association class Relates a system level driver, network protocol, and network adapter.
The Operating System Events subcategory groups classes that represent events in the operating system related to processes, threads, and system shutdown.
Event class Represents computer shutdown events.
Event class Represents events related to a computer system.
Event class Represents device change events resulting from the addition, removal, or modification of devices on the computer system.
Event class Indicates that a process has loaded a new module.
Event class Base event for module events.
Event class Indicates that a new process has started.
Event class Indicates that a process has terminated.
Event class Base event for process events.
Event class Indicates that the device list on the system has been refreshed (a device has been added or removed, or the configuration changed).
Event class Base class for all system trace events, including module, process, and thread traces.
Event class Indicates a new thread has started.
Event class Indicates that a thread has stopped.
Event class Base event class for thread events.
Event class Represents a network-mapped drive event resulting from the addition of a network drive letter or mounted drive on the computer system.
The Operating System Settings subcategory groups classes that represent the Operating System and its settings.
Instance class Represents the boot configuration of a Windows system.
Instance class Represents a computer system operating in a Windows environment.
Association class Relates a computer system and a processor running on that system.
Instance class Represents a product.
Association class Relates two interdependent base services.
Instance class Represents a group of system services that define execution dependencies.
Instance class Represents an association between a base service and a load order group that the service depends on to start running.
Association class Relates a load order group and a base service.
Instance class Represents an operating system installed on a Windows computer system.
Association class Relates an operating system and product updates applied as represented in Win32_QuickFixEngineering.
Instance class Represents the types of information that will be gathered from memory when the operating system fails.
Instance class Represents system-wide Quick Fix Engineering (QFE) or updates that have been applied to the current operating system.
Instance class Represents a command that runs automatically when a user logs onto the computer system.
Association class Relates a computer system and its boot configuration.
Association class Relates a computer system and its desktop configuration.
Association class Relates a computer system and a logical device installed on that system.
Association class Relates a computer system and a load order group.
Association class Relates a network connection and the computer system on which it resides.
Association class Relates a computer system and its operating system.
Association class Relates a computer system and a process running on that system.
Association class Relates a computer system and a logical program group.
Association class Relates a system resource and the computer system it resides on.
Association class Relates a computer system and a service program that exists on the system.
Association class Relates a computer system and a general setting on that system.
Association class Relates a computer system and a system driver running on that computer system.
Association class Relates a computer system and a time zone.
Association class Relates a computer system and a user account on that system.
The Processes subcategory groups classes that represent system processes and threads.
Instance class Represents a sequence of events on a Windows system.
Instance class Represents the startup configuration of a Windows process.
Instance class Represents a thread of execution.
The class in the Registry subcategory represents the contents of the Windows registry.
Instance class Represents the system registry on a Windows computer system.
The Scheduler Jobs subcategory groups classes that represent scheduled job settings.
Instance class Represents an instance in time as component seconds, minutes, day of the week, and so on.
Instance class Represents a job scheduled using the Windows NT schedule service.
The Security subcategory groups classes that represent system security settings.
Association class Relates a security account instance with a security descriptor instance.
Instance class Represents an access control entry (ACE).
Association class Relates the security settings of a file/directory and one member of its discretionary access control list (DACL).
Association class Relates the security settings of a file/directory one member of its system access control list (SACL).
Association class Relates the security settings of a file/directory and its group.
Association class Relates the security settings of a file/directory and its owner.
Instance class Represents security settings for a logical file.
Association class Relates the security settings of a share and one member of its DACL.
Association class Relates the security settings of a share and one member of its SACL.
Instance class Represents security settings for a logical file.
Instance class Represents information about privileges required to complete an operation.
Instance class Represents a structural representation of a SECURITY_DESCRIPTOR.
Instance class Represents security settings for a managed element.
Instance class Represents the rights granted and denied to a trustee for a given object.
Instance class Represents the auditing for a given trustee on a given object.
Association class Relates the security of an object and its group.
Instance class Represents security settings of a file or directory object.
Instance class Represents security settings of a share object.
Association class Relates an object to its security settings.
Association class Relates the security settings of an object and its owner.
Instance class Represents an arbitrary SID.
Instance class Represents a trustee.
The Services subcategory groups classes that represent services and base services.
Instance class Represents executable objects that are installed in a registry database maintained by the Service Control Manager.
Instance class Represents a service on a Windows computer system.
The Shares subcategory groups classes that represent details of shared resources such as printers and folders.
Association class Represents a root or junction node of a domain-based or stand-alone distributed file system (DFS).
Association class Represents the relationship of a DFS node to one of its targets.
Association class Represents the target of a DFS node.
Instance class Represents the connections made from a remote computer to a shared resource on the local computer.
Instance class Represents the sessions that are established with the local computer by users on a remote computer.
Association class Relates a shared resource on the computer and the connection made to the shared resource.
Association class Relates a local printer and the share that represents it as it is viewed over a network.
Association class Represents an association between a session established with the local server by a user on a remote machine, and the connections that depend on the session.
Association class Represents an association between a logon session and the processes associated with that session.
Association class Relates a shared resource on the computer system and the directory to which it is mapped.
Instance class Represents a shared resource on a Windows system.
The Start Menu subcategory groups classes that represent program groups.
Instance class Represents a program group in a Windows system.
Association class Relates logical program groups (groupings in the Start menu), and the file directories in which they are stored.
Instance class Represents an element contained by a Win32_ProgramGroup instance, that is not itself another Win32_ProgramGroup instance.
Association class Relates the program group items of the Start menu, and the files in which they are stored.
Instance class Deprecated. Represents a program group in a Windows computer system. This class has been deprecated in favor of the Win32_LogicalProgramGroup class.
Association class Relates a program group order and an individual program group or item contained in it.
Instance class Represents a logical grouping of programs on the user's Start| Programs menu.
The Users subcategory groups classes that represent storage information.
Association class Represents the association between a chadow copy and the provider that creates the shadow copy.
Association class Specifies how a shadow copy is to be created, queried, or deleted.
Instance class Represents a duplicate copy of the original volume at a previous time.
Association class Represents an association between a shdaow copy provider and a storage volume.
Association class Represents an association between a shadow copy and the volume for which the shadow copy is created.
Association class Represents an association between a shadow copy and where the differential data is written.
Association class Represents a component that creates and represents volume shadow copies.
Association class Represents an association between a shadow copy and where the differential data is written.
Association class Represents an assocation between a shadow copy provider with a supported volume.
Instance class Represents an area of storage on a hard disk.
Association class Represents a volume to the per volume quota settings.
The Users subcategory groups classes that represent user account information such as group membership details.
Instance class Represents information about user accounts and group accounts known to the Windows system.
Instance class Represents data about a group account.
Association class Identifies the group accounts associated with a Windows NT domain.
Association class Relates a group and an account that is a member of that group.
Instance class Describes the logon session or sessions associated with a user logged on to Windows NT or Windows 2000.
Instance class Represents the mapped logical disks associated with the session.
Instance class Represents the network login information of a specific user on a Windows system.
Instance class Represents a system account.
Instance class Represents information about a user account on a Windows system.
Association class Relates a user account and a Windows NT domain.
The Windows NT Event Log subcategory groups classes that represent events, event log entries, event log configuration settings, and so on.
Instance class Represents data stored in a Windows NT/Windows 2000 log file.
Instance class Represents Windows NT/Windows 2000 events.
Association class Relates instances of Win32_NTLogEvent and Win32_ComputerSystem.
Association class Relates instances of Win32_NTLogEvent and Win32_NTEventlogFile classes.
Association class Relates instances of Win32_NTLogEvent and Win32_UserAccount.
Windows Product Activation (WPA) is an anti-piracy technology to reduce the casual copying of software.
Association class Relates instances of Win32_ComputerSystem and Win32_WindowsProductActivation.
Instance class Contains properties and methods to query and configure an Internet connection related to WPA.
Instance class Contains properties and methods related to WPA.
Classes that represent software related objects.
Relates a Windows Installer action with any locational information it requires.
Identifies a connection between an application and its command-line access point.
Represents any installed or advertised components or applications available on the system.
Represents binary information (such as bitmaps, icons, executable files, and so on) that are used by an installation.
Binds each executable file that needs to be bound to the DLLs imported by it.
Relates an Installer action with any locational information it requires.
Manages the registration of COM class information with the system.
Represents the command line interface to a service or application.
Represents the criteria used to determine the selection state of any entry in the Win32_Feature class.
Creates an empty folder for components set to be installed locally.
Makes one or more copies of files installed by the InstallFiles executable action, either to a different directory than the original file, or to the same directory, but with a different name.
Contains information about any environment variables that may need to be registered for their associated products installation.
Manages the registration of extension related information with the system.
Represents a source file with its various attributes, ordered by a unique, non-localized identifier.
Registers installed fonts with the system.
Contains the .INI information that the application needs to set in an .INI file.
Identifies the computer system on which a particular software element is installed.
Contains a list of conditions, all of which must be satisfied for the action to succeed.
Relates an Installer feature with an action used to register and/or publish the feature.
Registers the MIME-related registry information with the system.
Locates files that already exist on the user's computer, and move or copy those files to a new location.
Abstract class that represents any resource used by the Installer during the course of an installation, patch or upgrade.
Represent attributes that are set off an ODBC driver.
Relates an Installer check with any setting information it requires.
Specifies any data source (DSN) that needs to be registered as part of an installation.
Relates an Installer check with any setting information it requires.
Allows you to determine the software element of which the ODBC driver is a part.
Represents any ODBC driver to be installed as part of a particular product.
Represents attributes set for an ODBC data source.
Represents any ODBC translator that is included as part of a product's installation.
Represents an individual patch that is to be applied to a particular file and whose source resides at a specified location.
Relates an Installer check with any setting information it requires.
Describes a patch package that has been applied to this product.
Represents a product as it is installed by Windows Installer.
Relates instances of CIM_Check and Win32_Product.
Relates instances of Win32_Product and Win32_MSIResource.
Identifies the software features for a particular product.
Represent any ProgID that needs to be registered during a given installation.
Contains the property names and values for all defined properties in the installation.
Manages the advertisement of the components that may be faulted in by other products with the system.
Sets up registry information that the application desires in the system registry.
Uninstalls files previously installed by the InstallFiles action.
Deletes .INI file information that the application desires to delete.
Reserves a specified amount of disk space in any directory, depending on the installation state of a component.
Processes all the modules in the SelfReg module to register the modules, if installed.
Represents instructions for controlling both installed and uninstalled services.
Represents a service to be installed along with an associated package.
Represents instances of Win32_ServiceSpecification and Win32_Service.
Relates an Installer check with any setting information it requires.
Manages the creation of shortcuts.
Allows you to identify a connection between an application access point and the corresponding shortcut.
Represents a software element, part of a software feature.
Relates an Installer software element with an action that access the element.
Relates an Installer element with any condition or locational information that a feature may require.
Represents conditional checks that must be evaluated to TRUE before their associated Win32_SoftwareElement instance can be installed.
Relates a software element with a resource used by that software element.
Represents a distinct subset of a product, consisting of one or more software elements.
Relates an Installer feature with an action used to register and/or publish the feature.
Relates an Installer feature with any condition or locational information that a feature may require.
Generic association that establishes dependency relationships between objects.
Identifies the software elements that make up a particular software feature.
Registers type libraries with the system.
Classes used to manage WMI.
The WMI Configuration class derives methods that configure the WMI service.
Abstract, base class that implements method parameters derived from this class.
The WMI management classes represent operational parameters for the WMI service.
Contains the operational parameters for the WMI service.
Association between a service running in the Windows system, and the WMI settings it can use.
Classes that represent formatted and raw performance data.
Classes derived from the Win32_PerfFormattedData abstract class contain data in which samples and intervals have been used to create a calculated value by the high-performance provider.
Abstract base class for the formatted data classes.
Represents performance counters for the Active Server Pages device on the computer system.
Represents performance information about an Indexing Service filter.
Represents performance data about the state of the Indexing Service.
Represents counters that monitor Internet Information Services (the Web service and the FTP service) as a whole.
Represents performance data from the HTTP Indexing Service.
Represents Microsoft Distributed Transaction Coordinator performance counters.
Represents global counters for the Exchange NTFS Store driver.
Represents counters that monitor logical partitions of a hard or fixed disk drive.
Represents counters that monitor hard or fixed disk drives on a computer.
Represents counters that measure the rates of announcements, enumerations, and other browser transmissions.
Represents counters that monitor network connections originating at the local computer.
Represents counters that monitor communications using the WINS Server service.
Represents counters that monitor the length of the queues and objects in the queues.

Represents counters that monitor the file system cache, an area of physical memory that stores recently used data as long as possible to permit access to the data without having to read from the disk.
Represents counters that describe the behavior of physical and virtual memory on the computer.
Represents counts of the objects contained by the operating system such as events, mutexes, processes, sections, semaphores, and threads.
Represents counters that monitor the paging file(s) on the computer.
Represents counters that measure aspects of processor activity.
Represents counters that apply to more than one instance of a component processors on the computer.
Represents counters that monitor the virtual address usage of images executed by processes on the computer.
Represents counters that monitor the virtual address usage of images executed by processes on the computer.
Represents the accounting and processor usage data collected by each active named job object.
Represents detailed performance information about the active processes that make up a job object.
Represents counters that monitor running application program and system processes.
Represent counters that monitor memory allocation and use for a selected process.
Represents counters that measure aspects of thread behavior.
Represents counters that measure aspects of thread behavior that are difficult or time-consuming to collect.
Represents flow statistics from the packet scheduler.
Represents pipe statistics from the packet scheduler.
Represents counters that monitor individual Remote Access Service ports of the RAS device on the computer.
Represents counters that combine values for all ports of the Remote Access service (RAS) device on the computer.
Represents the number of local network interfaces visible to, and used by the RSVP service.
Represents RSVP or ACS service performance counters.
Represents counters specific to the SMTP Server.
Represents performance statistics about a print queue.
Represents the telephony system.
Represents consists of counters that measure the rates at which messages are sent and received by using ICMP protocols.
Represents counters that measure the rates at which IP datagrams are sent and received by using IP protocols.
Represents counters that measure the rates at which bytes are sent and received over the NBT connection between the local computer and a remote computer.
Represents counters that measure the rates at which bytes and packets are sent and received over a TCP/IP network connection.
Represents counters that measure the rates at which TCP segments are sent and received by using the TCP protocol.
Represents counters that measure the rates at which UDP datagrams are sent and received by using the UDP protocol.
Represents terminal services summary information.
Represents terminal services per-session resource monitoring.
Represents counters specific to the World Wide Web Publishing Service.
Classes derived from the Win32_PerfRawData abstract class contain the original, uncalculated form of the performance data.
Abstract base class for all concrete raw performance counter classes.
Represents the Active Server Pages device on the computer system.
Represents performance information about an Indexing Service filter.
Represents performance data about the state of the Indexing Service.
Represents counters that monitor Internet Information Services (the Web service and the FTP service) as a whole.
Represents performance data from the HTTP Indexing Service.
Represents Microsoft Distributed Transaction Coordinator performance counters.
Represents global counters for the Exchange NTFS Store driver.
Represents counters that monitor logical partitions of a hard or fixed disk drive.
Represents counters that monitor hard or fixed disk drives on a computer.
Represents counters that measure the rates of announcements, enumerations, and other browser transmissions.
Represents counters that monitor network connections originating at the local computer.
Represents counters that monitor communications using the WINS Server service.
Represents counters that monitor the length of the queues and objects in the queues.
Represents counters that monitor the file system cache.
Represents counters that describe the behavior of physical and virtual memory on the computer.
Represents counts of the objects contained by the operating system such as events, mutexes, processes, sections, semaphores, and threads.
Represents counters that monitor the paging file(s) on the computer.
Represents counters that measure aspects of processor activity.
Represents counters that apply to more than one instance of a component processors on the computer.
Represents counters that monitor the virtual address usage of images executed by processes on the computer.
Represents counters that monitor the virtual address usage of images executed by processes on the computer.
Represents the accounting and processor usage data collected by each active, named Job object.
Represents detailed performance information about the active processes that make up a Job object.
Represents counters that monitor running application program and system processes.
represent counters that monitor memory allocation and use for a selected process.
Represents counters that measure aspects of thread behavior.
Represents counters that measure aspects of thread behavior that are difficult or time-consuming to collect.
Represents flow statistics from the packet scheduler.
Represents pipe statistics from the packet scheduler.
Represents counters that monitor individual Remote Access Service ports of the RAS device on the computer.
Represents counters that combine values for all ports of the Remote Access service (RAS) device on the computer.
Represents the number of local network interfaces visible to, and used by the RSVP service.
Represents RSVP or ACS service performance counters.
Represents the counters specific to the SMTP server.
Represents performance statistics about a print queue.
Represents the telephony system.
Represents counters that measure the rates at which messages are sent and received by using ICMP protocols.
Represents counters that measure the rates at which IP datagrams are sent and received by using IP protocols.
Represents counters that measure the rates at which bytes are sent and received over the NBT connection between the local computer and a remote computer.
Represents counters that measure the rates at which bytes and packets are sent and received over a TCP/IP network connection.
Represents counters that measure the rates at which TCP Segments are sent and received by using the TCP protocol.
Represents counters that measure the rates at which UDP datagrams are sent and received by using the UDP protocol.
Represents terminal services summary information.
Represents terminal services per-session resource monitoring.
Represents counters specific to the World Wide Web Publishing Service.
Base schema classes.
Creates a software element in its next state or eliminates the software element in the current state.

Defines a series of operations that transition the software element (referenced by the CIM_SoftwareElementActions association) to its next state, or removes the software element from its current state.
Indicates which elements can be spares or replace other aggregated elements.
Describes the layout of slots on a hosting board or adapter card.
Provides summary information about addressable logical blocks, which are in the same storage redundancy group and located on the same physical media.
Defines the number of addressable logical blocks on a single storage device, excluding logical blocks mapped as check data.
Describes the aggregate physical extent in a storage redundancy group.
Emits audible or visible indications related to a problem situation.
Represents an association between logical devices and system resources, and indicates that the resource is assigned to the device.
Represents an application or software system that supports a particular business function that can be managed as an independent unit.
Represents an association that identifies the software features that make up a particular application system.
Associates an alarm with a logical device.
Associates a battery with a logical device.
Indicates when fans or other cooling devices are specific to a device.
Associates installed or associated memory, such as cache memory with a logical device.
Associates the processor and system memory, or a processor's cache.
Associates an installed sensor with a logical device.
Associates a power supply with a current (amperage) sensor that monitors its input frequency.
Associates a power supply with a voltage sensor that monitors its input voltage.
Describes how storage extents can be assembled from lower-level extents.
Represents the capabilities and management of the battery logical device.
Provides a boolean output.
Represents the low-level software that is loaded into non-volatile storage and used to start and configure a computer system.
Represents the capabilities of the low-level software that is used to start and configure a computer system.
Associates a BIOS feature and its aggregated BIOS elements.
Associates a BIOS element and the non-volatile storage in which it is loaded.
Associates the operating system and the file systems from which the operating system is loaded.
Represents the access points of a boot service.
Represents the functionality provided by a device or software, or by a network, to load an operating system on a unitary computer system.
Associates a boot service and its access points.
Defines the capabilities and management of cache memory.
Represents a type of physical container that can be plugged into another card or hosting board, or is itself a hosting board/motherboard in a chassis.
Associates an adapter card with the container into which it is inserted.
Describes relationships about cards that can be plugged into motherboards/baseboards, daughtercards of an adapter, or cards that support special card-like modules.
Represents a CD-ROM drive on the computer.
Represents the physical elements that enclose other elements and provide definable functionality, such as a desktop, processing node, UPS, disk or tape storage, or a combination of these.
Represents the 'containing' relationship between a rack and a chassis that it contains.
Represents a condition or characteristic that is expected to be true in an environment defined or scoped by an instance of a CIM_ComputerSystem class.
Represents the type of integrated circuit hardware, including ASICs, processors, memory chips, and so on.
Represents the access points of a clustering service.
Represents the functionality provided by a cluster.
Represents the relationship between a clustering service and its access points.
Represents a collection of Managed System Elements (MSE) contained in a collection of MSEs.
Represents the members of the grouping object, a CollectionOfMSEs class.
Allows the grouping of CIM_ManagedSystemElement objects for the purpose of associating settings and configurations.
Represents the binary sensors that make up the multi-state sensor.
Represents the association between a CIM_CollectionOfMSEs and the setting class defined for them.

Represents an association between products that conveys information, such as whether two referenced products are interoperable, can be installed together, or whether one can be the physical container for the other, and so on.
Represents the parts of a relationship between MSEs.
Represents a special collection of CIM_ManagedSystemElement instances.
Represents an association between a computer system and its available direct memory access (DMA) channels.
Represents an association between a computer system and its available interrupt request lines (IRQs).
Represents an association between a computer system and its available memory-mapped I/O ports.
Represents an association that explicitly defines the relationship between unitary computer systems and one or more physical packages.
Represents an association between a computer system and its available system resources.
Allows the grouping of parameter sets (defined in CIM_Setting objects) and dependencies for one or more managed system elements.
Represents an association that indicates that two or more physical connectors are connected.
Represents an association that makes explicit the containment relationship between connectors and packages.
Represents an association between a contained and a containing physical element.
Indicates which devices are commanded by, or accessed through, the controller logical device.
Groups miscellaneous control-related devices.
Represents the capabilities and management of cooling devices.
Represents moving or copying files from a computer system to a new location.
Creates empty directories for software elements to be installed locally.
Exists for backward compatibility to earlier CIM Schema definitions.
Represents a named collection of data or executable code.
Represents an association that establishes dependency relationships between objects.
Associates a CIM_Dependency class with one or more CIM_Configuration objects.
Represents the capabilities and management of the desktop monitor (CRT) logical device.
Specifies the logical device accessed by using the referenced CIM_DeviceFile class.
Represents two or more connected devices.
Contains error-related counters for a logical device.
Represents a type of logical file, which represents a device.
Represents an association between a service access point (SAP) and how it is implemented.
Represents an association between a service and how it is implemented.
Identifies software that is associated with a device, such as drivers, configuration or application software, or firmware.
Represents a file type that logically groups the data files that it contains and provides path information for the grouped files.
Manages directories.
Represents an association between a directory and files contained within that directory.
Captures the major directory structure of a software element.
Represents the directory that contains the file being specified by referencing the CIM_DirectorySpecification class.
Reports a set of legal string values.
Represents a physical disk drive as seen by the operating system.
Represents the capabilities and management of a diskette drive.
Represents a contiguous range of logical blocks that is identifiable by the operating system by way of the partition's type and subtype fields.
Checks the system's amount of available disk space.
Groups miscellaneous display devices.
Represents computer architecture direct memory access (DMA).
Represents the relationship between two chassis.
Associates a CIM_PhysicalCapacity object with one or more physical elements.
Relates a CIM_Configuration object to one or more managed system elements.
Represents the association between managed system elements and the setting class defined for them.
Represents physical elements that are cabled together by a physical link.
Associates the CIM_DeviceErrorCounts class to the logical device to which it applies.
Represents files that can be executed on the system where the software element is installed.
Represents an association between a local file system and its directories, which indicate that the specified directories are available for mount.
Indicates that the aggregated elements have more capacity or capability than is needed.
Represents the capabilities and management of a fan cooling device.
Allows the author to locate files that already exist on a user's computer, and then move or copy those files to a new location.
Represents a file that is either on or off the system.
Links the file system and the logical files addressed through the file system.
Represents a file or data set local to a computer system or remotely mounted from a file server.
Represents the capabilities and management of the flat panel logical device.
Identifies the source directory for the file action.
Identifies the source directory for the file action.
Represents a vendor-defined collection of products and physical elements that are associated with a field replaceable unit (FRU) to support, maintain, or upgrade a product at the customer's location.
Indicates that a FRU can be composed of other products.
Represents the physical elements that make up a FRU.
Represents the capabilities and management of a heat pipe cooling device.
Represents an association between a service access point (SAP) and the system on which it is provided.
Defines the hosting unitary computer system for a CIM_BootSAP class.
Associates a hosting system and a boot service.
Represents a link between the computer system and the file system hosted on the computer system.
Represents an association between a job destination and the system on which it resides.
Represents an association between a service and the system on which the functionality resides.
Represents the capabilities and management of an infrared controller.
Represents a link between the computer system and the installed operating system.
Associates a computer system with an installed software element.
Represents an Intel architecture interrupt request line (IRQ).
Represents a unit of work for a system.
Represents where a job is submitted for processing.
Specifies where a job is submitted for processing.
Represents the capabilities and management of the keyboard logical device.
Associates cables and links used as physical connectors, which connect the physical elements.
Represents the file store controlled by a computer system through local means (for example, direct device-driver access).
Represents the position and address of a physical element.
Represents a hardware entity that may or may not be realized in physical hardware.
Represents a contiguous range of logical blocks that is identifiable by a file system through the disk's DeviceId (key) field.
Associates a logical disk with the disk partition on which it resides.
Relates logical disks with the volume on which they are found.
Represents the base class for all system components that represent abstract system components, such as profiles, processes, or system capabilities, in the form of logical devices.
Represents a named collection of data, which can be executable code, that is located in a file system on a storage extent.
Indicates that two logical elements represent different aspects of the same underlying entity.
Represents the capabilities and management of a magneto-optical drive, a subtype of the media access device.
Represents the base class for the system element hierarchy.
Represents the the capabilities and management of a management controller.
Represents the ability to access one or more media, and then use the media to store and retrieve data.
Describes a relationship where a storage extent must be accessed through a media access device.
Represents the capabilities and management of memory-related logical devices.
Represents memory that can be installed on a physical element and its minimum and maximum configurations.
Specifies a condition for the minimum amount of memory that needs to be available on a system.
Represents computer architecture memory-mapped I/O.
Associates physical memory located on hosting boards, adapter cards, and so on.
Associates physical memory with a physical media and its cartridge.
Represents the information for modifying a specific setting file, for a specific entry, with a specific value.
Represents the relationship between horizontal and vertical resolutions and the refresh rate and scan mode for a desktop monitor.
Associates the monitor resolution with the desktop monitor to which it applies.
Represents an association between a file system and a directory to which it is attached.
Represents a multi-member set of binary sensors where each binary sensor reports a Boolean result.
Defines general networking hardware concepts.
Represents a remote file system that is mounted, using the network file system (NFS) protocol, from a computer system.
Represents the capabilities and management of non-volatile storage.
Represents a numeric sensor that returns numeric readings and optionally supports thresholds settings.

Represents a computer operating system, which is comprised of software and firmware that make a computer system's hardware usable, and implements and manages the resources, file systems, processes, user interfaces, services, and so on that are available on the computer system.
Represents the software features that make up the operating system.
Associates the operating system and one or more processes running in the context of the operating system.
Specifies the versions of the operating system that can support a software element.
Represents the relationship in which an alarm device is installed as part of a package.
Represents the relationship in which a cooling device is installed in a package, such as a chassis or rack, to assist with the package's cooling.
Represents an explicit relationship in which a component is typically contained by a physical package, such as a chassis or card.
Represents the relationship in which a chassis can contain other packages, such as other chassis and cards.

Represents the capability of complex networking devices, which are often chassis-based, to enhance or augment the base functionality by accepting additional chassis devices (similar to accepting functionality in the form of adding cards).
Represents the relationship in which a temperature sensor is often installed in a package, such as a chassis or a rack, to monitor the package's environment.
Represents the capabilities and management of the parallel port logical device.
Identifies physical elements that should be replaced together.
Represents the properties and management of a PCI controller.
Represents the capabilities and management of a Personal Computer Memory Card International Association (PCMCIA) controller.
Represents the capabilities and management of a personal computer video controller, a subtype of a video controller.
Represents the physical extents that participate in a storage redundancy group.
Represents a physical element's minimum and maximum requirements and its ability to support different types of hardware.
Represents a low-level or basic component within a package.
Represents any physical element that is used to connect to other elements.
Defines any component of a system that has a distinct physical identity.
Associates a physical element with a CIM_Location object for inventory or replacement purposes.
Represents an SCC RAID implementation.
Represents a superclass of rack, chassis, and other frame enclosures as they are defined in extension classes.
Represents the cabling of physical elements.
Represents types of documentation and storage medium, such as tapes, CD ROMs, and so on.
Represents low-level memory devices, such as SIMMS, DIMMs, raw memory chips, and so on.
Represents physical elements that contain or host other components.
Represents a device that points to regions on the display.
Represents a device that translates binary data into wave modulations for sound-based transmission by connecting to the Plain Old Telephone System (POTS) network.
Represents the capabilities and management of the power supply logical device.
Represents the capabilities and management of the printer logical device.
Represents a single instance of a running program.
Represents a link between a process and data file, and indicates that the file participates in the execution of the process.
Represents the capabilities and management of the processor logical device.
Represents a link between a process and the threads running in the context of the process.
Represents a collection of physical elements, software features and, other products, acquired as a unit.
Represents an association between the product and a field replaceable unit (FRU), which provides information about product components that have been, or are being replaced.
Defines a parent-child hierarchy among products.
Represents the physical elements that make up a product.
Represents an association between two products, which indicates that one must be installed or absent for the other to function.
Identifies the software features for a particular product.
Represents an association between product and support access that conveys how support is obtained for the product.
Represents addressable logical-block addresses, which are treated as a single storage extent, but are located on a single physical extent.
Associates protected space extents that are based on a physical extent.
Represents a rack (a physical frame or enclosure) in which chassis are stored.
Represents the association that defines the mapping between a logical device and the physical component that implements the device.
Represents the relationship in which the CIM_AggregatePExtent class is realized on a physical media.
Represents a disk partition on a physical media that models the creation of partitions on a raw SCSI or IDE drive.
Represents the relationship in which physical extents are realized on a physical media.
Causes a system reboot where the software element is installed.
Associates a redundancy group composed of managed system elements and indicates that, together, the elements provide redundancy.
Represents a collection of managed system elements, which indicates that the aggregated components, together, provide redundancy.
Represents the capabilities and management of a refrigeration cooling device.
Represents hierarchies and dependencies of related CIM_StatisticalInformation classes.
Represents a remote file system that is accessed by way of a network-related service.
Removes directories for software elements.
Uninstalls files.
Aggregates physical elements that must be replaced together.
Represents an association between a file system and the storage extent where it is located.
Represents the currently executing operating system.
Indicates that the second SAP is required for the first SAP to connect with its service.
Represents the capabilities and management of the scanner logical device.
Represents the capabilities and management of the SCSI controller logical device.
Represents a CIM_ControlledBy relationship that indicates which devices are accessed through a SCSI controller and the access characteristics.
Represents a hardware device that is capable of measuring the characteristics of a physical property.
Represents the capabilities and management of the serial port, logical device.
Represents a CIM_ControlledBy relationship that indicates which devices are accessed through the serial controller and the characteristics of the access.
Represents a logical element that contains information to represent and manage the functionality provided by a device or software feature.
Represents the access points for a service.
Represents the ability to use or invoke a service.
Represents an association between a service and a service access point (SAP), which indicates that the referenced SAP is used by the service to provide its functionality.
Represents an association between two services.
Represents configuration-related and operational parameters for one or more managed system elements.
Specifies information needed to check a particular setting file for a specific entry that contains a value equal to the value specified.
Associates configuration objects with setting objects.
Represents connectors into which packages are inserted.
Represents the ability of a special adapter to extend the existing slot structure to enable otherwise incompatible cards to be plugged into a frame or hosting board.
Decomposes a CIM_SoftwareFeature object into a set of individually manageable or deployable parts for a particular platform.
Identifies the actions for a software element.
Relates a software element with condition or location information that a feature may require.
Represents a type of software element that must exist in the environment.
Represents a particular function or capability of a product or application system.
Represents an association between a service access point (SAP) and how it is implemented in software.
Represents an association between a service and how it is implemented in software.
Identifies the software elements that make up a specific software feature.
Indicates that one or more of the aggregated elements can be spared.
Represents a root class for the arbitrary collection of statistical data or metrics applicable to one or more managed system elements.
Represents an association that relates managed system elements to the statistical groups that apply to them.
Collects the storage errors for a storage extent.
Represents blocks of media or memory space that are mapped out-of-use due to errors.
Represents the capabilities and management of the various media that exist to store data and allow data retrieval.
Represents mass storage-related redundancy information.
Specifies how to obtain assistance for a product.
Specifies the amount of swap space that needs to be available on the system.
Aggregates an enumerable set of managed system elements.
Establishes 'part of' relationships between a system and the managed system elements of which it is composed.
Represents an explicit relationship in which logical devices can be aggregated by a system.
Represents an entity managed by BIOS, or an operating system that is available for use by software and logical devices.
Exists for backward compatibility with earlier CIM schema definitions.
Represents a tape drive on the system.
Exists for backward compatibility with earlier CIM schema definitions.
Represents the ability to execute units of a process or task, in parallel.
Identifies the target directory for the file action.
Identifies the target directory for the file action.
Represents the capabilities and management of an uninterruptible power supply (UPS).
Represents a desktop, mobile, network computer, server, or other type of single-node computer system.
Represents the capabilities and management of a USB controller.
Defines the hubs that are downstream of the USB controller.
Represents the management characteristics of a USB device.
Represents the capabilities and management of a USB hub.
Allows a computer system's user to input, view, or hear data.
Specifies whether it is permissible to create the next state of a software element.
Represents the low-level software that is loaded into non-volatile storage and used to configure and access a computer system's video controller and display.
Represents the capabilities of the low-level software used to configure and access a computer system's video controller and display.
Associates a video BIOS feature and its aggregated video BIOS elements.
Represents the capabilities and management of the video controller.
Represents the various video modes that a video controller can support.
Associates the CIM_VideoControllerResolution setting object with the controller to which it applies.
Represents the capabilities and management of volatile storage.
Exists for backward compatibility with earlier CIM schema definitions.
Represents a contiguous range of logical blocks presented to the operating environment for reading and writing user data.
Represents the capabilities and management of a WORM drive, a subtype of the media access device.
